Text: The two hired paws have fallen at your feet, leaving only one final member of this accursed movement of man-eaters. It seems the two goons had fulfilled their purpose perfectly. Having delayed your advance for a precious few seconds, Randall seems ready to initiate his ritual after all. He stands calmly in the middle of the circle on the ground, turned halfway away from the commotion as if he is not even aware there is a fight for life and death going on. With both paws, the wolf clutches a sizeable chunk of amber, polished and glimmering, neatly cupped in the palms of his paws.

Randall squeezes the crystal so tightly that a sharp edge pierces the palm of his paw, and a droplet of blood stains the mineral. He does not seem to notice, eyes closed, muzzle raised up high in the air as if smelling the air. The shard absorbs the crimson stain, a tiny wisp of red smoke dissipating from the surface.

The deep, brilliant amber changes color, darkening like old, dried blood, before settling on a deep blue. Its misty hues swirl under the surface like a turbulent ocean. The wolf raises his paw, clutching the crystal tightly as it pulses with a gentle glow.

Beside you, Rux starts, his eyes widening with horror. Whatever he sees that you do not, it effortlessly peels away the professional, grandfatherly attitude the red panda has always worn. "NO, DON'T!" he shouts in uncharacteristic panic, reaching out with one paw, hopelessly far away.

But the leader of the Red Maw does not hear him. His eyes are open now, narrowed, focused. He searches for something, and finds it a moment later. With sudden violence, Randall thrusts his arm forward, stabbing empty air with the charged crystal. His arm sails through nothing, until the wolf meets resistance, as if having struck an invisible wall. The discolored amber shard dissolves into dust, carried away by the wind. A rush of cold air washes over you, a shockwave that ruffles fur and disturbs dead leaves on the worn stones.\n\nThen, a network of thin, pale blue cracks forms in the open air. They snake away in all directions, like a window had been struck with a hammer and is barely holding itself together. The mystical disturbance is no bigger than a snowball, suspended two meters above the ground, before it explodes. The spider web of cracked glass expands violently, reality itself shattering before your eyes. Ghostly white light, ocean-blue at the edges, engulfs the black wolf.

The second blast pushes you back, interrupting any attempt to charge forward. Shock and self-preservation take precedence for Iso as she stumbles, while the Adept braces himself against a pillar, muttering to himself. Currents of superheated air rush over you like a storm wind threatening to knock you down on your back, forcing you to use your arm to shield yourself. Your face stings in the intense heat; you feel your throat being singed with each breath you take.\n\nAbove the turbulence, and the pained curse of Iso falling over backwards, there is another sound. Piercing, rumbling. It is close by; dead ahead in fact. And when you catch glimpses of Randall's contorting form, awash in a light too bright to look upon for long, you realize. The wolf is screaming.

He changes. The silhouette of his body grows, fingers stretching into monstrous claws. His chest and arms bulge with muscle unbefitting of someone with his dietary choices. In the blinding glow of this unsealed, forbidden power, it is difficult to make out the details of the ongoing transformation. This had not gone according to plan at all.

Were you too late? Was there anything you could have done to change this outcome? These thoughts race across your mind as you watch Randall writhe in what must surely be unimaginable agony. Had the two goons been conscious still, they would no doubt have joined their enemies in observing the spectacle in silent awe.

Then your eyes land on Rux, who is desperately trying to put out a pale blue fire on the sleeve of his left arm, teeth clenched in pain.

The Adept grimaces and stumbles, barely managing to keep himself from falling over as he rubs at the wisps of flame. You barely have enough time and presence of mind to process what you see underneath. The sleeve of Rux's maroon robe has burned away, revealing a huge crystal amidst singed fur, bright amber in color, fused with his flesh. He had hidden it well all this time.\n\nIt sits on top of the back of his forearm like a scab, only smooth and polished on the surface, as if his arm had been covered in tree sap. Orange energy swirls violently underneath the surface, far faster and more intense than you recall other crystals to have been. Somehow, it seems to be reacting to the strands of pale blue mist sent flying from Randall's simmering bubble. Bracing himself against a pillar with the other paw, Rux steadies himself, and without any ceremony, the flames vanish.

Just like that, the show is over. The light dissipates, the spider web of broken glass in the air receding but not quite disappearing. Moss and grime all around the circle of glyphs has been incinerated, fully revealing the flagstones underneath for the first time in countless years. At the epicenter stands a hulking biped of a wolf. At first glance, it seems like Randall was merely sized up several notches, but there is more to the change than just that.\n\nMuscle ripples underneath jet-black fur, a thick, bushy tail swaying behind him. The wolf himself takes a moment to drink in his new form, before his muzzle snaps upwards - to you, then to the pantheress. A pale, ocean-blue round gem is set into the back of each hand, almost pulsing. Piercing yellow eyes glimmer with malice, as a strand of drool drips from the beast's maw. A glistening, meaty tongue erupts from between those black lips to remove it, and he begins approaching, a growl building in his throat. A little unsteady on his feet at first, the transformed wolf speeds up rapidly.

Those feral eyes lock on to his prize, his ex-fiancée, as that slobbery tongue travels across his lips again. "Don't... run..." he rumbles, voice low and gravelly. What kind of ravenous predator could be more dangerous than one capable of reason and thought? An intellect sits behind those slavering jaws - this is far more than some mindless beast.\n\nBefore you have time to contemplate the philosophy of Randall's new form, Rux snaps out of the stupor first, taking a step back and beginning to circle around the approaching wolf. His eyes seem to be set on the glyphs set into the ground, now inert and burned out. "Keep him busy!" he shouts, wincing when he touches his burned arm. "I'll do what I can!" With that promise in mind, the two of you exchange nods, preparing for the fight of your life.

Despite having fallen for a feint, {attacker} {attacker correct} {attacker.possessive} swing at the last second to make contact. With a crunch, the side of Ethel's skull takes the brunt of the blow. Only a drop of blood is drawn, but the bluebird keels right over, never recovering from the sidestep he had been trying to make. Instead, he drops down on his side and stays down for a lot longer than he should. Clearly no longer a threat, the lucky strike must have rattled the avian so thoroughly as to leave him reeling and panting, barely keeping himself from passing out.
Now, though, time is better spent focusing on more important matters, like not getting eaten.

A quick, sharp strike from {attacker.aliaspossessive} {!weapon} on the side of Mako's head leaves him with a horrifying gash across the throat. Mako collapses to the floor like a bag of sand, gurgling and convulsing as he bleeds out. Terror and panic flashes in his eyes, the husky no longer physically capable of voicing his despair as his life fades. Not a pretty way to go. You wonder for a fleeting moment if you should be feeling sympathy, though you expressly agreed with your party that there would be no mercy for these monsters today.

A quick strike from the side of {attacker.aliaspossessive} {!weapon} on the side of Mako's head leaves him staggered. A moment later, he collapses to the floor like a bag of sand, unmoving. You agreed with your party that it would be worth the effort to try and bring in some of these monsters in one piece, and hence you leave him where he falls. There would be time to tie him up later.

To the side, Ethel makes a surprised, coughing guffaw, having just barely roused from his stupor, and draws were-Randall's attention. Those predatory irises narrow, and without warning, his hind legs tense and he pounces. Cutting through the air exactly like an apex predator claiming a meal, Randall lands right on top of the now rather frightened bluebird. "I finally have a use for you, meat," he snarls, saliva dripping from his lips. Ethel tries to say something, to try and placate the monster that he would have once called an ally, before that maw parts wide and dives down. The avian finally receives a taste of his own brew.

It takes the giant canine only a few short moments to devour his first meal - the bird doesn't stand a chance. The prey slips down that slimy gullet with terrifying speed. Randall was always a capable predator, but the size difference takes his abilities to new heights. Disgustingly loud, wet swallows echo through the ruined chapel, Ethel's struggling chest and legs disappearing down the hatch, never to be seen again. A final swallow sends the bird down, the werewolf's furry stomach swelling to contain its occupant.\n\nRandall belches, and turns to Iso. It almost seems like he forgot he just swallowed another person whole, if not for the rapid, panicked struggling and muffled shouting coming from that frightening belly dome.

Then, a toothy grin spreads on the lycanthrope's muzzle, almost proud to show off his appetite to the love of his life. He glances down and presses both paws on that writhing bulge - hard. The cacophony of digestive sounds picks up rapidly. Mixed in with a particularly nasty grrrroooorgle, you think you hear several things crack and disintegrate in there. The furry dome begins softening and receding at a wholly unnatural pace. The prey sealed within stops kicking, and you can see the size of the digestive organ shrink in a matter of seconds as its contents liquify and drain deeper, lumps softening and smoothing out into a thick, soupy slurry. The gems on his paws swirl and shimmer with otherworldly energy.

His wounds recede just as quickly as his meal did. Flesh stitches itself back together and fur regrows, undoing the damage you had done. Ethel gave his life - or perhaps it was taken from him - to grant his boss another shot. The gurgling and sloshing slows down, only a soft potbelly left of what was an adult-sized person just a few moments ago. Randall, for his part, seems to take this new ability in stride, licking his lips. He examines his arms, a toothy smirk showing just how pleased he is with the sheer might of this form.

Iso shivers when the werewolf glares at her, grinning, thick tail swaying behind him. "Don't worry, love," he snarls, strands of slobber leaking from his lips. This time, he doesn't bother to clean it away. "For you, I'll take it slowly. I want to feel you melting in there all night." With a snarl, he turns to you. "But first... You."

His quarry, admirably, remains silent. You glance around quickly, and manage to spot Rux nearby, hunched over the chalk markings. Time runs out, and the both of you brace as the apex predator pounces.

Iso flings a small vial at you, and just before you black out, you manage to chug down the whole thing. A rush of energy fuels the fire within you. "I don't have any more, keep going!" she shouts from behind you.

Your combined attacks stagger the monster, blood streaking through his fur. Despite towering over the two of you, Randall is obviously frustrated at having his prey evade him again, when she is right there in his reach.

Perhaps having decided that you are the bigger threat of the two, the werewolf decides to deal with you first. Squeezing your shoulders tightly, he pulls you in close. A moment later, his jaws part wide, fetid wolfbreath washing over you. There is no trace of the monster's previous meal, and you might almost think he hadn't eaten in weeks if the saliva production is any indication. With two meaty paws Randall lifts you off the ground effortlessly, pinning your arms to your sides. With the difference in size, devouring you is a trivial matter - your head easily fits inside Randall's maw. Before your partner has a chance to react, you are already two swallows deep in the werewolf's gullet.

Tight flesh squeezes at you from all sides, and you feel yourself going light-headed in seconds. Even with the predator being so much bigger than you are, there is no air or wiggling room within the skin-tight esophagus, and being upside down really isn't helping either. It's obvious Randall is not taking any time to savor his meal; you slide down the hatch with speed no regular-sized predator would ever be able to match. Crushing waves of peristalsis force you down, one swallow at a time, without any regard for the fact that you are a living, breathing person. To him, you are nothing more than a {player.furry} chunk of calories, not deserving of any recognition or celebration - and so there is no point in drawing out the inevitable. Something wraps around your ankles at around the same time your nose presses into the stomach. At first you think it's the wolf's tongue, before you realize it's a paw, trying to brace against the pulsating flesh. It's hopeless, of course.

With a final, thundering, wet gulp, your feet and tail are sent down this one-way trip through a werewolf's digestive tract. Whoever was trying to pull you out is forced to let go, lest they take the same dive themselves - though at such close range, no doubt Randall would have no trouble claiming dessert, should he choose to do so. Free of obstructions, your face slides into the sack-like organ and presses into a chunky pool of mush and chyme. By the time you've almost processed the literal depth of your predicament, the esophagus finishes dumping the load of meat that is your body into the werewolf's core. Slimy, pulsating walls knead you into a tight ball of food, packed together in this pulsating, suffocatingly hot and acidic hell.\n\nYou can hear muffled voices on the outside, and as the stomach begins digesting you alive, the slimy prison sways back and forth. Randall must be on the move somehow, fluids sloshing this way and that, but it makes little difference for you.

It does not take long for your teamwork with Iso to become impressively synchronized. You adopt a rhythm of drawing the werewolf's anger, and giving your ally an opening in which to strike. This goes back and forth for several moments, each adding a new shallow gash to the werewolf's collection.\n\nStill, you are keenly aware that each second brings you closer to the inevitable fatal mistake. Randall swipes claws through the air and bites at where your throat had been a second ago. It is only a matter of time before either of you tire and slip up, to then slip down the wolf's gullet.

Luckily, you do not have to wait for that to happen. While the monstrous canine is briefly distracted with Iso, the red panda hollers for your attention from a slight distance away. The Adept has been tinkering with the glyphs and runes on the ground, changing them - but there is no time to look in detail. He throws something at you, then - an amber shard, charged and glowing bright orange.

You barely manage to catch the gem, fumbling in a successful attempt to not drop it on the floor. "Stab him with that! Now! I'll hold the channel open!" Rux shouts.

The crystal is unnaturally cool to the touch. It glimmers, almost sparkling with colors that are the polar opposite of the pale ocean-blue on Randall's paws. Strange, mystic energy shifts underneath the surface, pulsing, almost alive. It makes your skin crawl. You look up again when Randall roars with untamed fury. The beast salivates, his feral eyes glimmering with hatred, as he charges toward you once more. All you need to do is to hang on a moment longer.

'Forgotten' is probably one of the better words with which to describe Dalsida Abbey. A winding road springs from the surrounding woods at the base of the hill, packed dirt and loose gravel gradually giving way to cobblestones. There, you stumble upon a ruined courtyard, sun-bleached flagstones forming a circular path around an overgrown marble fountain. Thinner paths, stones mossy and cracked, branch off from the central ring to a complex of buildings all around. Straight ahead stand the crumbled remains of a chapel to some deity no-one remembers, roof collapsed and stained glass long since disintegrated. This must have been a place of glorious splendor once, though what little the elements haven't destroyed, looters have taken.

Or perhaps that is not entirely true. One thing still remains of the abbey's former glory, untouched by time and thievery. A palpable tension lingers in the air - one that you are unsure to attribute either to nerves, or to something more supernatural. These ruins are graveyards, protecting something ancient that, if it were up to you, would remain exactly where it is. Your party seems to have sensed the same thing, though nobody speaks. Perhaps it would have been less risky to not ascend the main path into the abbey, but there is no one else here to greet you. If the Red Maw has already invaded this monastery, they would likely be further up ahead, and so it is that you carefully make your way forward.

This part of the plan had not been thought through particularly well. The next actions of your crew depend entirely on whether the enemy has already arrived and made a mess. However, the abbey is deceptively quiet and peaceful. The wind picks up for a brief moment, ruffling clothes and picking up leaves from the ground, before settling down again a moment later. Still, a modicum of stealth would be well-advised, so the three of you creep along crumbling walls. The chapel looms ahead, standing imposingly tall despite the damage, and you approach it, one step at a time. Rux and Iso fall in silently behind you, having taken to your judgement as de-facto leader.

Dipping into the ruin's shadow, you approach the nerve junction of the monastery - literally and otherwise - and carefully look around. The chapel has several 'entrances', most of them little more than holes in the outer wall, allowing you to pick your approach. Sticking to undergrowth, your party moves along the rightmost edge of the building, before creeping inside, through and over the collapsed remains of a wall section.

There, you behold the interior of the chapel. It is surprisingly intact for its age - none of it is pretty or remotely usable, but the fact that any of it is still standing despite the disrepair is impressive. The interior is relatively modest for the kind of building; a wide open space with a central pathway leading to the altar, lined by wooden pews on either side. Leaves and foliage crawl through and wind around broken windows, and decorations have been stolen or disintegrated, but otherwise the room remains very recognizable. A marble statue of some manner of revered person hugs the right wall through which you sneak in. With large chunks of the statue missing - not least of which the head - it is impossible to determine who it might have depicted. Your companions join you a moment later.

There, you behold the interior of the chapel. It is exactly like you remember it from the last time you visited: overgrown structures, rotted pews and a dilapidated-but-recognizable altar. Sneaking in past the decapitated marble statue, you take stock of the situation. Your companions join you a moment later.

Several pews and rusted braziers have been overturned near the center of the room to create some open space, a stone's throw away from the altar and what was once a lectern. Your breath catches in your throat when you recognize the duo hunched over new decorations of their own making. Mako - the black-and-white husky - is busy drawing rough chalk markings on the floor while Randall is instructing him, reading from a few pages of notes clutched in his paws. From your position, the actual drawings are obscured, though it is unlikely you would be able to divine their purpose anyhow.

Far sooner than you would have hoped, Mako's muzzle swivels and he suddenly stares straight at you, ears perked, nostrils wide. "Company," he growls. The wolf beside him glances over his shoulder and sighs. His gaze turns towards a bluebird who had been idly running a wing over faded inscriptions on a pillar, just barely out of your view. "Ethel, you are fucking useless," Randall grunts, finally drawing the surprised avian's attention. "Can't even be a lookout. I am actually going to eat you."

A scowl forms on the wolf's muzzle as his gaze locks onto you - or more precisely, the smooth {player.furry} dome sticking out from your midsection. "Oh, me you won't associate with, but this {player.species} is good enough for you, isn't {player.object}?"

The husky abandons his work, rising to his feet and taking a few tentative steps towards the three of you. Ethel soon joins him, saying nothing, perhaps a little flustered at having been caught shirking work again. "Deal with them, I'll finish up here quickly," the leader demands, his command entirely unnecessary seeing as the other two predators are already approaching. He gets down on his knees to pick up where Mako had left off.
The time for diplomacy has long since passed. Six people entered the chapel today, and only three will be leaving. The only way to ensure that you are among that group, is the hard way.

Despite your predatory tendencies, there would be no time to scarf either of these two down your throat. With both of the approaching enemies being experienced at their craft, cramming one down your gullet would leave you critically vulnerable. Instead, this issue will have to be solved the hard way.

As much as you would want to, your stomach is still full with the hapless idiot you scarfed down on the way here. You won't be able to fit down another now - not to mention doing so would leave you dangerously vulnerable anyway. Instead, this issue will have to be solved the hard way.
{defender} staggers and drops down to a knee, down and out for the count.

A loud, gnarly crunch sounds from somewhere within the solid mass of your stomach contents as the organ subdues its rebellious meal, a bubble of air displacing and swiftly released in the form of a wet belch. The taste of meat and bile rises to the back of your tongue, and you quickly swallow it back down, continuing to focus on the task at hand. It seems that at least this one attacker will never be a threat to anyone again.

With the prey's feet disappearing from view, your paws starting to roam and rub up and down your gut almost entirely on instinct, you glance up to find Iso staring at you, grimacing. "Holy shit, {player.name}, not you too," she whispers, just barely dodging the slicing motion of a weapon dancing through the space where she had been standing just before. That level of distraction is not a healthy preoccupation in the middle of a struggle for life and death, after all. As your prey settles fully in the depths of your gut, wobbling and fighting against their fate as {player.species}-fat, the black-furred pantheress manages to tear her gaze away from you to focus on the scene. "That's... sick. I can't trust anybody," she grunts.

In a swift, smooth motion, you part your jaws wide enough to send flecks of saliva flying. As {prey.aliaspossessive} eyes widen with realization and fear, you engulf their head all at once. With a greedy swipe of the tongue to mat down the thug's fur and dislodge the hood covering their features, though with them already lodged in your gullet, it's too late to actually make out any identifying features. Not that it matters: this preything is reduced to nothing but food, and all food is the same in the end. The first swallow reverberates through the trees, and you draw several stunned pairs of eyes as you devour your meal. Nobody dares interrupt the predator at work, the fight more or less pausing.\n\nStruggling is useless at this point for {prey}; each gulp pushes them deeper into the crushing depths of your digestive tract. The dry, tasteless fabric of their clothes rubs against your tongue, the cloth quickly draining your maw of moisture, making for a rather unpleasant eating experience. Still, spurred on by the incredible flavors lingering on the fur you'd already gulped down, saliva production is in overdrive, and with a few slow, wet swallows your stomach begins expanding to accommodate the load of fresh meat. An incredible feeling of predatory euphoria washes over you as your meal's legs slide down your throat, gravity assisting in the prey's devourment, and with a final, rumbling belch, they are sealed away in a slimy, acidic pit. That's all you can fit, but oh, does it feel good.

Your pleasant walk in the woods is interrupted by three figures emerging from the dense forestry. Clad in identical, dull black leather armor, faces covered with cloth wrappings, their only identifying features are general body shape, and tail. The trio - rodent, canine and feline - approach, and your two companions stop in their tracks, already expecting the worst.

"Finally," quips the feline. From their voice alone, you cannot quite tell their gender, but perhaps it doesn't really matter. "Told you they'd leave eventually." The smaller fellow beside them, a rodent of some description, sneers and steps forward, pulling a short, sharp blade from their belt. "Been too long since I got to cut someone up. Mmm, maybe I'll let you choose which limb I go for first."

The last remaining assassin glances anxiously at the three of you, perhaps finally realizing the little hitsquad had grossly underestimated the threat, stumbles backwards. {^thug} sheathes their weapon and turn tail, leaving their comrades to their fates by sprinting away as fast as their legs - and the mushy soil - can carry them.

The last remaining assassin glances anxiously at the three of you, perhaps finally realizing the little hitsquad had grossly underestimated the threat, puts everything they have into pushing you backwards. {^thug} winds up dropping onto the ground, scrambles up and turns tail, leaving their comrades to their fates by sprinting away as fast as their legs - and the mushy soil - can carry them.

The robed figure doesn't get particularly far until their escape attempt is disrupted. A huge, snarling mass of gray-and-silver fur erupts from between the trees. Chip pounces on the biped that had dared to make a fool of his master, pinning his target not with his front paws like most ferals would when hunting, but rather, with wide open jaws. {^thug} realizes too late what is happening and can do nothing but watch as they are engulfed in that slimy maw with a wet squelch. The wolf, for his part, wastes little time, tossing his muzzle upwards with each swallow, his meal disappearing down his gullet with staggering speed. The display is a stark departure from how comparatively gently the wolf had treated you before when you'd taken a dive down his throat. It's obvious Chip has no intent of letting this meal back out through the same way they went in.

The robed figure doesn't get particularly far until their escape attempt is disrupted. A huge, snarling mass of gray-and-silver fur erupts from between the trees. Chip pounces on the biped that had dared to make a fool of his master, pinning his target not with his front paws like most ferals would when hunting, but rather, with wide open jaws. {^thug} realizes too late what is happening and can do nothing but watch as they are engulfed in that slimy maw with a wet squelch. The wolf, for his part, wastes little time, tossing his muzzle upwards with each swallow, his meal disappearing down his gullet with staggering speed. You briefly wonder what it would feel like to be rammed down a slimy tube with such violence.

A soft, furry bulge soon forms on Chip's belly as the form of his prey slides down his gullet, vanishing into his chest only to reappear soon after as a hallmark of a satisfied predator. The swollen dome shifts and writhes, the meat within struggling for dear life. A useless endeavour, of course - they wouldn't be leaving without Chip's blessing. The oversized canine in question doesn't even bother to pay attention to the dying struggles of his meal, instead preoccupied with licking his lips and releasing a loud, wet belch. A drool-soaked black scarf slides from his tongue, landing on the ground with a splat. To your side, Iso looks a little perturbed at this whole chain of events, while Rux looks mostly impassive, or, perhaps... proud?

"At least I can't blame an oversized guard dog for eating people," the mayor mumbles, casting a sidelong glance in your general direction. Her gaze lingers on your hugely distended {player.furry} gut, lumps shifting underneath as the organ pushes its contents around mercilessly. Rux is silent, though you do find yourself wondering what opinion swims behind those tired eyes of his.

"Here, boy," the red panda commands, and with perked ears, the massive lupine bounds over like a newborn pup desperate for love and attention. Rux receives a wet slurp on the face for his trouble, and returns rubs and muzzle scritches in kind. It is obvious how much the two have bonded over the years, and if it weren't for the fact that a person is literally drowning in digestive fluids right this moment, the exchange might have been considered cute. Before long, though, Rux sends the monstrous guard dog on his way, and Chip cheerily trots off in the direction where you came from, back to the cabin. You exchange glances with Iso, and the Adept raises an eyebrow while cleaning the slobber of his fur with a small towel he'd retrieved from nowhere. "What?" he asks.

Just as you are about to give chase, Iso takes aim and flings her knife into the walls of trees. The blade cleaves through the air, falling short of the fleeing adversary who, wisely, had shifted directions. Dirt and dry leaves scatter on the ground where the weapon lands harmlessly, its target escaping. Neither you nor Rux judge the assailant easy to apprehend at this point. By the time the panicked, rapid footfalls fade away into the distance, Iso shrugs and casually walks over to her blade to retrieve it.

"The only good thing I have to say to you, {player.name}, is that at least that one won't get away," the mayor mumbles, casting a sidelong glance in your general direction. Her gaze lingers on your hugely distended {player.furry} gut, lumps shifting underneath as the organ pushes its contents around mercilessly. The red panda is silent, though you do find yourself wondering what opinion swims behind those tired eyes of his.

Deciding it best to pursue a different conversation topic, Iso scratches the side of her muzzle. "So who were these? Spirits, am I going to have to start worrying about being assassinated now too?" She sighs, sticking her paws in her sides as she takes in the scene before her. "I thought becoming the mayor was a good thing. I wanted to help people, give them the channels they need to get stuff done. I know you can't please everyone, but... this..."

Ever the comforting presence of the crew, Rux gives his friend a hearty chuckle, his striped tail swaying back and forth once. "You'll be fine, Iso. Making enemies is part of the job, and it's just another obstacle you can overcome."

The mayor, in turn, considers this, unsure how to respond for a few moments. Content to instead stick her paws in her coat, she steps away from the corpse at her feet with a wide berth, before continuing to walk in the direction you had been traveling before this distraction took place. "Let's... just go. We have somewhere to be," she quips, not really waiting for either of you to follow her in kind.

Not wanting to be caught dawdling, you begin moving as well, but not before the Adept prods the ground with his staff, sighing. "I'm getting too old for this," he rumbles quietly.

While 'home' would be a lengthy walk away still, you had another manner of business to attend to. Telling your companions to go on ahead, you vanish into the thick of the woods to take care of the other half of the digestive process. Whether you had eaten live prey for pleasure or out of necessity, it matters little now - the conversion into chyme applies the same way to all food.\n\nAway from prying eyes, you lean against a random tree with knees bent, your tail hiked, before you push. A familiar pressure emerges on your tailhole. It stretches around a solid log of {player.species} scat, extruding from your anus before breaking off under its own weight. Another one follows, and a pile of dung forms on the forest floor. As you might expect from a carnivore with an efficient digestive system, nary a bone shard is to be found in the smooth, brown mass; only digested meat and the occasional, rare tuft of discolored fur.

Your bowels have methodically disassembled the self-assured, cocky asshole of a wolf just like it had done to any other piece of meat you've swallowed throughout your life. Some 'apex predator' he was - useful in the end only for his nutritional value and a pleasant shit. Perhaps it is what he really deserved, in the end, to be squeezed out from under a superior predator's tail, dumped behind some shrubbery in a nameless forest.

Your bowels had done a number on that useless thug you'd eaten a few hours ago. Contented, the apex predator's breathing slows, muscles losing tension. Precious few seconds later, he lies still.

His body shrinks before you, muscular arms deflating, chest compacting. Silence reigns as Iso finally moves over and helps you back up on your feet. As you consider subjecting the wolf to the same acidic fate he had bestowed on so many others, you feel the body of that useless thug you'd swallowed an hour or two ago bulging out your stomach, slowly digesting. This monster had gotten away with more than enough. It's time he gets a taste of his own medicine - and you are absolutely starving. You roughly brush Iso aside, part your jaws wide, and dive in. Randall's eyes widen in surprise and fear, and a paw rises up to meet your snout, though he is far too weakened to actually provide any resistance whatsoever.\n\n"N-no, wait-" the dying wolf stammers before the entirety of his head is engulfed inside your own. Your co-conspirator gasps behind you, and you hear a desperate, distant plea for you to stop, to leave the lupine, but you pay her no mind. The predator inside you takes over, and there is a delightful meal here to be devoured. Your tongue slathers your prey in thick, rough coatings of warm, sticky saliva, and copious strands of slobber leak from your lips.

Loud, greedy swallows reverberate through the ruined chapel as you down the injured canine with record speed. Truly a delicious, filling meal; if anything, it's a miracle the wolf had managed to dodge the stomachs of other predators up until now.\n\nHe barely resists, though as his naked form slides across your tongue, one gulp at a time, he can't quite stop his legs from kicking. They are pitiful, of course; with only his lower legs still sticking out of your carnivorous maw and his arms already soaked in drool and sinking down the hatch, there is nothing for him to brace against. The only other evidence of his fear and displeasure is the singular whimper you can hear from deep within you.

As your {player.furry} stomach begins bulging out with the slab of wolf meat, Randall's form goes surprisingly still. Either he ran out of steam, or he resolved to accept his ultimate fate as {player.species}-fat - either way, it does not really matter. He will digest just like everyone else. Powerful, predatory ecstasy floods your brain as your digestive tract swells with live prey to process, and a few more gulps are all you need to seal away the scourge of the Red Maw once and for all. The last of your meal slides down your esophagus, settling in the rank pit at your core. A wet, saliva-flecked belch robs the prey of what little air he had left in there, and the rumbling sounds of digestion set in quickly.\n\nTurns out you were the superior predator after all.

The next thing you know is a flash of pain in your cheek. You'd stopped paying attention to what your compatriots were up to, and it takes a brief moment for you to realize that you had just been on the receiving end of a left hook. Iso's wide eyes, stricken with tears, glare into yours, bleeding rage and the hurt of betrayal. You stagger backwards, your stuffed stomach gurgling and groaning in protest.\n\n"Fuck you, {player.name}! How could- could you?!" The pantheress stumbles back and forth, uncertain and fidgeting, clearly unsure what to do or where to leave her paws. "He wasn't... I-I... He wasn't yours to kill."

The pantheress breathes heavily, barely managing to rebuild her composure, though the haunted glimmer of betrayal never leaves her eyes. "I-I thought you were... in better control... than that. He wanted us dead, but I wish he..." Iso's words trail off, the pantheress unable to bring herself to speak the words. With a heavy sigh, she turns tail and departs the chapel, through the same hole in the wall you had ventured in through. Whatever, you have a delightfully pleasurable meal to digest.

The pantheress breathes heavily, barely managing to rebuild her composure, though the haunted glimmer of betrayal never leaves her eyes. "I-I... I thought you weren't... but you're just a sicko like the rest..." Iso's words trail off, the pantheress unable to come up with a more coherent response. With a heavy sigh, she turns tail and departs the chapel, through the same hole in the wall you had ventured in through. Whatever, you have a delightfully pleasurable meal to digest.

Rux studies you for several moments, seemingly searching for something in your drool-flecked, satisfied face. He scratches his chin with one paw, the amber crystal embedded in his forearm glimmering despite having gone inert.\n\n"Maybe he deserved it, but I advise you to take caution, {player.species}, lest you find yourself walking the same path," he warns. With a soft sigh, he shakes his head, before a ghost of a smirk creeps onto his muzzle. "I'm already sheltering one voracious 'guard dog'; I suppose another wouldn't change much. The dominating soundscape in your ears is that of your captor's body at work. Fluids churn through the intestines somewhere below you, an omen of the fate that is about to befall you. All you have for company as you breathe your final breaths is a thundering heartbeat above you, pumping blood to the overfull digestive organs. Something inside you gives way with a crack, but it doesn't really hurt. You've long lost sensation in most places, your thoughts making way for an empty void. With a bubbling sigh, you let go, and with a mighty squeeze, the stomach claims you.

Though the body of the werewolf is a brutally effective meat grinder - both inside and out - it cannot absorb everything it digests. The remains of his beloved pantheress have blended together with the nutritious chyme of some {player.species} and the bluebird before {player.object}, pumping through the perfect carnivore's intestines overnight. Randall himself pays little mind to the inner workings of his digestive tract, instead far more focused on the dull pressure underneath his tail. His stomach sloshes back and forth as he squats in a secluded spot in the woods, the prey-smelting chamber still slightly swollen with food to process. He'll be full for a little while longer.

Nevertheless, the giant wolf's first meal demands release. His thick tail rises, and with a soft grunt, he allows his anus to widen. The exposed pucker stretches around the first log of werewolf shit as it slides out, and then another. The smooth mass of digested food is entirely free of fur or bone chips, a testament to the extreme efficiency of a true apex predator's body. Utterly unrecognizable scat piles up on the forest floor, different prey no longer distinguishable in the mess. Were it not for the frightening size of the droppings, one might not even have been able to tell that this is now the grave marker of a few persons.\n\nRandall's stomach lets out a lewd gurgle as he finishes dumping his prey, his tailhole clenching shut after expelling a final solid chunk of waste. The huge lupine barely even bothers to look at the pile of wolf shit he'd produced before his tail drops and he walks away. Two paws idly roam around the soft, pudgy bulge on his middle as it continues chipping away at its contents, while Randall himself decides to make his way toward civilization, already licking his lips in anticipation.

Without the threat of the Red Maw looming over them, the people of Finmer can sleep easy for a little while longer.
